title.narrative: Indigenous communties en route to the Pan-Amazonian synod

description.narrative: This project is a continuation of PER292, but with a particular focus on women. It forms part of a wider project funded by Development and Peace on promoting care of the Amazon and respecting the rights of indigenous peoples. There is a recognised need to consolidate coordination of the different local Amazonian churches with indigenous peoples, and the aim for the overall project is to continue collaborating with these churches, promoting communication networks so that the relationship between the ecclesial jurisdictions is strengthened and efforts are united during this synodal process. CAFOD's project, as part of this wider project, sets out to strengthen the participation of Amazonian indigenous women in preparations for and attendance at the synod now that the Instrumentum Laboris has been published, so that their voices are heard and that the Amazonian church gathers together all of these voices. This participation will be enabled through listening and public events, press articles and participation of indigenous women in the Amazon synod in Rome in a public event and the publication of a leaflet on Pan-Amazonian indigenous women. The aim is to achieve a much deeper reflection, through a political, social, ecological, cultural, spiritual and ecclesiastical analysis, from the perspective of indigenous women from the Amazon. Finally, indigenous women's participation will be strengthened by producing communications materials in indigenous languages. Ultimately the aim is, as Pope Francis said, for the Church to have a truly Amazonian face.
